H0.text: what type of religion did massachusetts have. Puritanism

H1.text: what type of religion did massachusetts have. Anglicanism

H2.text: what type of religion did massachusetts have. Congregationalism

H3.text: what type of religion did massachusetts have. Judaism

A4.text: Congregationalism in the United States traces its origins to the Puritans of New England, who wrote the Cambridge Platform of 1648 to describe the autonomy of the church and its association with others.

A5.text: Within the United States, the model of Congregational churches was carried by migrating settlers from New England into New York, then into the Old Northwest, and further.
